data.title: Upgrade to first-mate@1.2
data.body: This updates first-mate to fully support `contentName` in grammars which was causing major issues for people using the PHP package since it heavily uses `contentName` in the grammar.

data.title: regexes match in non-regex find and replace
data.body:
`\n` will match newlines regardless of the regex mode of the find ui

additionally, to match `\n`, `\r`, `\t`, in non-regex mode requires `\\n`, `\\r`, `\\t` and in regex mode requires `\\\\n`, `\\\\r`, `\\\\t` which is lol.

data.title: editor:split-selection-into-lines adds an extra cursor
data.body:
via support/5b7b56d8a04711e394e183068a86b6e7

```
When selecting multiple, if I choose 'Split into Lines' the trailing row after the selection is also included.

If the last character of the selection is a carriage return, the next row should not be included 'Split into Lines'.
```

data.title: Pasting cyrillic text causes a bunch of problems
data.body:
It causes the cursor to be misplaced and a few other oddities.

via support/7745a758a12611e38253cc5de0e9b06f

data.title: initial attempt at CSP policy to see what breaks
data.body:
This PR aims to enable CSP for Atom to prevent XSS that leads to command execution via Node.  This initial pass unfortunately requires us setting the `unsafe-eval` value for the `script-src` directive.  This seems to be needed in order for the dev spec tests to be able to auto-generate some JS via `eval()`.  The stack trace can be found below. So, it would be nice if we could come up with a way to allow unit tests to run without having to directly inherit the CSP policy.  Also, I still need to add a few unit tests.  I just wanted to post the PR early so that folks could chime it regarding anything they think might break, workarounds for any issues that come up, etc.

@nathansobo @thedaniel @mastahyeti @gregose 


data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell@0.10.5
data.body:
Atom-Shell Changelog:
- Fix crashes caused by dialog API.
- Disable undocked devtools.
- Fix web security.
- Disable node integration in iframes by default.
- Add `activate-with-no-open-windows` event for app.
- Provide debug symbols on Linux.

data.title: Remove apm from node_modules
data.body:
Now that `apm` ships node we no longer need to copies of it distributed with atom, one for the CLI and one when spawned from the settings view, package generator, etc.

This breaks backwards compatibility since `atom.packages.getApmPath()` now requires spawning it using `BufferedProcess` instead of a `BufferedNodeProcess`.

data.title: Converts keystrokes with alpha chars using shift
data.body:
Currently, keystrokes that use shift and an alpha char aren't handled correctly. For example, if you put...

``` coffeescript
'.editor':
  'cmd-shift-u': 'editor:select-line'
```

...into your keymap file it wouldn't trigger, but `cmd-U` would. This pull normalizes all keystrokes that use alpha chars and the shift key so they match the pattern `modifier-capitalLetter`

data.title: Fix position translation bug for wrapped lines with hard tabs
data.body: Fixes #1681

data.title: Serialize project
data.body: This retains the cursor position across reloads/restarts of Atom

data.title: Keybindings with shift aren't resolving properly
data.body: `cmd-shift-l` doesn't resolve to `cmd-L`

data.title: When scrollbar is visible, account for it when soft wrapping lines
data.body:
Fixes #1342 

Still in progress. Need to add some specs.

![soft-wrap-scrollbars](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1789/2327428/ae8cacb8-a3ef-11e3-93fd-9c79b786e3db.gif)

data.title: Add `fullscreen` class to body/html when in Full Screen mode.
data.body: This would allow for specific styles when in Full Screen.

data.title: Fix "check for update" crash
data.body: Click "Check for update" was causing Atom to crash when the dialog appeared. I wasn't able to fix the dialog problem because it seems to be a deeper atom-shell issue. Instead I replace the "Check for Update" menu item with a "Downloading Update" menu item.

data.title: Changing the line height doesn't refresh the editor window completely
data.body:
Reported by a bunch of users, but here's just a few tickets:
- http://discuss.atom.io/t/changing-line-height-padding/746
- support/844c3cc4a06211e39ab82f635e0f0670
- support/a3e02322a14b11e384488aede392eb71

When the `line-height` is changed in styles.less, that editor window is left in a weird semi-refreshed state where the cursor is not aligned with the lines:

![screen shot 2014-03-04 at 7 37 55 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/38924/2325293/7ef5f750-a3d3-11e3-8d7a-afd35f623fe3.png)

Reloading the window or switching tabs fixes the issue, but the problem shows up again after Atom is restarted.

data.title: Accessibility
data.body:
Was using Atom today during a presentation.

While Atom's not necessarily part of that evaluation, I noticed that VoiceOver thought the focus was on the close button the entire time. 

Since we're in a web browser, theoretically accessibility should be a given, but may be something to keep in mind going forward if it's an easy fix.

//cc @muan, @nuclearsandwich, @eanakashima

data.title: Touch files on save?
data.body:
support/2347f9369fef11e3946f08ae2636949d?page=1

Not sure if this is something we want to do, but interesting feedback nonetheless. The user wants to run his guardfile whether his contents changed or not on `core:save`

data.title: Close All Buffers command doesn't do its thing
data.body:
Reported here:
- support/6a2a05d0a08311e39329b8b7f0583149

![screen shot 2014-03-04 at 7 02 36 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/38924/2324288/4f1c50e4-a3c7-11e3-96cd-e1f2c99398b5.png)

While the "Close Buffer" command correctly closes the currently open buffer, it seems that the "Close All Buffers" command doesn't do anything.

data.title: Make word regex language specific
data.body: As is discussed in atom/autocomplete#13, for a language like CSS, a `-` character needs to be considered part of a word. Allowing the word regex to be overridden with a syntactic scope would allow the autocompleter to work more intuitively in CSS.

data.title: Provide a "untrusted html view".
data.body:
In addition to [locking down iframes](https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/193#issuecomment-36634975) and [enabling CSP](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1682) I think it might be nice to provide a top level API that extensions can use to render HTML safely.  Extensions such as markdown-preview take a string of HTML and render it in a div within the main Atom UI.  As a result, the HTML is rendered in the same context as the rest of Atom (with Node integration).  While CSP should mitigate much of the risk associated with this, it doesn't totally solve the "render untrusted HTML" issue.  For example, user content could potentially still break the DOM of the main Atom app. So, we could just ask that markdown-preview use a sandboxed iframe to minimize the issues that could arise from rendering user provided content.  But, I was thinking it might be a nice API primitive if we allowed any extension to hand us a string of HTML and we render it for them. I'm not sure how extensible this would need to be (ex. does the rendered HTML inherit CSS styles from the outer frame, etc), but it does seem like a nice security API.

@kevinsawicki @mcolyer @nathansobo @gregose @mastahyeti

data.title: npm ca issue
data.body:
In a rush to get things working again when the [npm cert](http://blog.npmjs.org/post/78085451721/npms-self-signed-certificate-is-no-more) issue happened I disabled strict ssl checking since the jankys use the version of npm that was broken.

After more research we could just use a custom `.npmrc` file during the atom bootstrap that sets `ca` to an empty string and also starts caching modules in `~/.atom/.npm` so that it can be cleaned when we want to reset CI.

data.title: Enable CSP by default
data.body:
XSS in Atom can directly lead to local command execution on a user's machine. So, in addition to fixing the specific instances we identify, we really need to find an additional line of defense to protect Atom users. I have had it enabled since yesterday and have not really noticed any issues other than a few errors in the debug console related to jQuery feature detection. I ran all the Atom specs and nothing seems to have broken. So, this seems like a good path to go down before we leave beta. I think CSP combined with [locking down iframe security](https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/193) should get us in a much better spot regarding security.  

@zcbenz @kevinsawicki @gregose @mastahyeti

data.title: When softwrap is turned on, the end of the screen line is sometimes unresponsive to mouse click.
data.body:
From a [halp ticket](https://halp.githubapp.com/inboxes/atom/discussions/ac60ad549fd011e3826d9a3ee801b188?page=1):

```
http://spotvin.com/atombug.mov

In this HTML file you can see the line wraps, and I am unable to select
the text at the end of the line. When I resize so the line doesn't wrap,
I can select the text fine. With the line wrapped, text input occurs at
a different position in the line that where the cursor shows.

I did change the settings to allow wrapping, but as far as I can see
this is not desirable behaviour - apologies if my fiddling with settings
or choosing inconsistent preferences is the cause for this rather than a bug.
```

data.title: Minor documentation tweaks/fixes
data.body:
A few tweaks to the docs:
- fixed one instance where "+" was used instead of "-" in a keybord shortcut
- added links to CSON and CoffeeScript to the docs (a link to LESS was already there)
- removed a public link to the apm repository which is currently private
- added a short init.coffee example, to go with the [short styles.less example](https://atom.io/docs/latest/customizing-atom#stylesless)

data.title: `atom -w` doesn't exit the git shell process if Atom is quit
data.body: It works fine if the window is closed with cmd-shift-w. But the git shell process will remain active if Atom is closed with cmd-q.

data.title: Make Atom's scrolling performance
data.body:
Some users are [complaining](https://halp.githubapp.com/inboxes/atom/discussions/b8deb792a0de11e390f34d400114b0b8?filter=inbox%3Aatom+state%3Aopen+sort%3Alast_interaction-asc) about horizontal and vertical scroll performance.

I feel like the speed is decent, but it is something we should look at during the next time we work on performance fixes.

data.title: Add `application:next-window` command
data.body:
Cmd+` does not exist on European keyboards, so people are unable to cycle through windows. We should expose a new command that let's people cycle though windows so people can rebind it to what that want.

[via discuss.atom.io](http://discuss.atom.io/t/command-to-switch-between-windows/2637/5)
